item.title: Battlefield 6 Is Toning Down The Wild Jumps And Slides Seen In the Open Beta
item.content:encoded:
The recent Battlefield 6 open beta was a massive success for EA and Battlefield Studios, amassing over half a million concurrent players on Steam. But some players werenâ€™t happy about how fast and jumpy movement could be in the online FPS, and others felt the shotgun was too powerful. Now EA has announced that hopping around with a shotty wonâ€™t be as effective in the full game.

On August 21, EA and Battlefield Studios published a lengthy community update on Twitter going over what was learned from the beta and what will be changed when the full game launches in October. The big news for many will be that, yes, the devs working on BF6 saw some of those wild videos of players hopping, sliding, and diving around in matches like itâ€™s a modern Call of Duty game and have plans to nerf how fast you slide and how often you can jump.

â€œMovement mechanics have been adjusted to create a more balanced and traditional Battlefield experience,â€ said EA in the community update post.  â€œMomentum, especially horizontal speed, carried from a slide into a jump has been reduced. There is now a greater penalty for consecutive jumps, which lowers jump height when jumps are spammed. Firing while jumping or sliding will result in increased inaccuracy.â€

According to the devs, the idea behind these changes is to make jumping and sliding â€œmore situationalâ€ and less useful during gunfights, with EA adding that it wants to reward â€œskillful movementâ€ but doesnâ€™t want gameplay to become â€œtoo fast or unpredictable.â€

The shotgun in Battlefield 6 is being nerfed

Another complaint out of the Battlefield 6 open beta was that the shotgun carried by assault class players was too powerful. As someone who loved using the shotgun, I disagree entirely and think people need to shut up. But the data does show that the shotgun was very effective at killing people. Maybe too effective? EA thinks so and is nerfing it a bit, explaining: â€œThe M87A1 shotgun now requires more pellets to secure a kill.â€ So it will still be good up close, but wonâ€™t be the powerhouse at medium range like it was in the beta.

Other weapon tweaks include a â€œgeneral pass on recoilâ€ and tap-firing across all weapons. EA wants to emphasize each gunâ€™s â€œunique feelâ€ and make sure weapons have more varied effective ranges.  â€œWeâ€™ve also made changes to encourage more controlled tap-firing and burst-firing, rewarding precision and weapon mastery,â€ said the team.

And EA is â€œinvestigating the Time-to-Kill and Time-to-Death experiencesâ€ in BF6, but doesnâ€™t have any â€œdefinitiveâ€ plans yet. Personally, I think people were being weird about time-to-kill in BF6â€˜s beta, as it is about the same as it was in BF4. But I do agree that sometimes youâ€™d die instantly, and it felt like only one shot. I assume this is down to some network issues that need to be fixed.

Player counts, Rush changes, and more

Elsewhere in the community update, Battlefield Studios talked more about player counts and how they work in BF6. The devs say the number of players in a match isnâ€™t strictly dictated by the mode, but the scale of the map. For example, at launch, some Breakthrough maps will support 48 players, while others will support 64 players. Itâ€™s an interesting strategy that lets the devs use every map for every mode, even if it means upping or lowering the maximum number of players that can get in on the action.

EA also talked about Rush and how the more players you add to the mode, the harder it becomes for one side to win. So, based on player feedback from the beta, EA is lowering the default number of players in Rush in the full game in October to give attackers a better chance of winning. Hopefully, the studio also changes where players spawn and how close the objectives are in Rush to help make matches more fun and less of a slog.

Oh, and for players who are part of BF Labs, youâ€™ll get a chance to test out some of the bigger maps coming to BF6 at launch, including the remake of BF3â€˜s beloved Operation Firestorm. EA confirmed that these two maps will â€œinclude the full complement of vehiclesâ€¦along with a more vast combat space.â€ So you can stop yelling at EA and Battlefield 6 devs about bigger maps. Theyâ€™ve told you before and now have explained again: Bigger maps will be in the full game. Relax, okay?

Battlefield 6 launches on October 10 across PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC.



https://kotaku.com/battlefield-6-ttk-shotgun-jumping-sliding-nerf-changes-open-beta-ea-patch-notes-2000619184

item.title: Overwatch 2 Is Getting A Persona Crossover, And No, Iâ€™m Not Joking
item.content:encoded:
Overwatch 2â€™s next season is bringing a water-bending hero, some major overhauls to its build-based Stadium mode, and new Perks for every character on the roster. Iâ€™m not here to talk about all that. Iâ€™m here to talk about the collaboration I could not have fathomed that was teased at the very end of the hero shooterâ€™s latest trailer. Blizzard and Atlus have worked out a deal to put skins based on Persona characters in the hero shooter. What a world we live in.

I do not care for the Fortnite-ification of Overwatch 2, which has become such a core part of Blizzardâ€™s strategy these days, so even though Persona is one of my favorite video game series of all time, Iâ€™m not particularly thrilled that this collaboration is happening. That said, I am morbidly curious as to what this collaboration ends up looking like. The brief clip at the end of the trailer shows someone dressed as Joker, the main character of Persona 5, but we only see them depicted as a silhouette, so itâ€™s unclear who is beneath the mask. Could it be Wuyang, the new support hero joining the roster this season? That doesnâ€™t seem like that much of a stretch. Beyond the mysterious Joker skin, we donâ€™t know if this is strictly a Persona 5 collaboration or if weâ€™ll see skins based on characters from other games like Persona 3 and 4. Blizzard could throw a real curveball in there and have cosmetics based on characters from the often-forgotten first two games. The teaser does include what seems to be a new Play of the Game animation made to look like Jokerâ€™s All-Out Attack victory pose, so it looks like weâ€™ll get more than just skins during the event.

Beyond turning Overwatch into Phantom Thieves, Overwatch 2â€™s season 18 is adding new modes and characters to Stadium, as well as allowing you to play it in Quickplay rather than just in ranked modes. This way, you wonâ€™t have to worry about losing your rank if you have a bad match or two. Stadium is already one of the biggest time sinks in Overwatch 2 and going through an entire game just to lose your rank feels bad, so this is a good alternative. In the main game, every hero is getting at least one new ability-altering Perk they can choose between over the course of a match. Some will be getting more than one new Perk, however, as Blizzard plans to rework more than 50 across all characters.

Lastly, Blizzard released a new animated trailer for Wuyang that gives us more insight into his family dynamics and also might tease that his sister, the fire-wielding Anran, may join the roster at some point down the line.

Season 18 begins on August 26.



https://kotaku.com/overwatch-2-season-18-persona-collaboration-skins-joker-2000619195

item.title: The Internet Reacts To Hollow Knight: Silksongâ€™s Big Day
item.content:encoded:
After six years, the clowning is over. Hollow Knight: Silksong is coming to a PC, Switch, Xbox, or PlayStation near you on September 4. Silksong has been conspicuously absent from industry events for so long that the act of anticipating the elusive Metroidvania has become a meme in and of itself. Now that itâ€™s imminent, what does the internet do with all that pent-up energy? They draw, yell, and celebrate.

So far, the most prominent reaction to the Silksong news beyond keyboard smashing is art that represents the end of a meme. For years, Hollow Knight fans have been depicting their constant waiting for a crumb of news with images of the gameâ€™s characters dressed in clown make-up. The joke got so popular that someone modded it into the original game, and Geoff Keighley even referenced it ahead of Gamescomâ€™s Opening Night Live show, where Silksong made an appearance. Now, fans are hanging up, throwing away, and burning their clown wigs and wiping off the makeup.

Time to hang up the costume. The wait is over (â ï¾‰â *â 0â *â )â ï¾‰@gamescom @TeamCherryGames #gamescom #Silksong #hollowknight pic.twitter.com/rbNxhF9jp1

today#hollowknight #SilkSong pic.twitter.com/hU7wxo2V9D

â€” Pynch.psd ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ (@pynchosa) August 21, 2025

â€” Miikrowelle (@Miikrowelle) August 21, 2025

Farewell â€œSilksong is fakeâ€ and clown makeup jokes pic.twitter.com/kuqdWWJzNp

â€” TheNCSmaster (@TheNCSmaster) August 21, 2025

Though the end of the clownery is one part of the equation, others are just expressing relief and excitement that theyâ€™ll finally be able to play the game theyâ€™ve waited more than half a decade for.

The end of todayâ€™s reveal trailer read â€œSeptember 4,â€ but didnâ€™t bother specifying â€œ2025.â€ Some are using this to joke that the wait may actually be far from over.

â€” Daniel Failboat (@Failboat103) August 21, 2025

Hollow Knight fans are lining up in droves to play Silksong at Gamescom; weâ€™ll see if those lines get a little smaller now that everyone knows the game is just two weeks away.

Hereâ€™s the line for the silksong demo at gamescom. They only have 10 game setupsğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ pic.twitter.com/c2HUjdhBPy

â€” BlueSR @ gamescom (@BlueGoesFast) August 21, 2025

Thatâ€™s not a lot of time, but it is enough time to play (or replay) the original Hollow Knight. Itâ€™s on just about any console you can imagine, and is still considered one of the best Metroidvania games of all-time. Thereâ€™s a reason people have been clowning for all this time.
